snippet: The executive and legislative branches of the government have responded to the financial crisis, but the courts have played a low-key role thus far, the author writes.
abstract: The executive and legislative branches of the government have responded to the financial crisis, but the courts have played a low-key role thus far, the author writes.

headline.main: The Financial Crisis in the Courts

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
